title: Reverse Trivia
description: Given the answer, can you guess the question?

questions.question: The answer is '206 bones.' What is the question?
options: How many bones in a cat?
How many bones in an adult human body?
How many bones in a horse?
How many bones in a dog?
questions.explanation: An adult human body has 206 bones. Babies are born with about 270 bones, but many fuse together as they grow.

questions.question: The answer is 'Neil Armstrong.' What is the question?
options: Who was the first person in space?
Who was the first person to walk on the Moon?
Who designed the Apollo spacecraft?
Who was the first American astronaut?
questions.explanation: Neil Armstrong was the first person to walk on the Moon on July 20, 1969, during the Apollo 11 mission.

questions.question: The answer is 'The Pacific Ocean.' What is the question?
options: What is the deepest ocean?
What is the largest ocean on Earth?
What ocean borders Australia's west coast?
What is the warmest ocean?
questions.explanation: The Pacific Ocean is the largest ocean on Earth, covering about 63 million square miles — more than all the land area combined.

questions.question: The answer is '1776.' What is the question?
options: When was the Constitution signed?
When did the American Revolution end?
When was the Declaration of Independence signed?
When was the Boston Tea Party?
questions.explanation: The Declaration of Independence was adopted on July 4, 1776, declaring the 13 American colonies free from British rule.

questions.question: The answer is 'Au.' What is the question?
options: What is the chemical symbol for silver?
What is the chemical symbol for gold?
What is the chemical symbol for aluminum?
What is the chemical symbol for copper?
questions.explanation: Au is the chemical symbol for gold, derived from the Latin word 'aurum.'

questions.question: The answer is 'Mount Everest.' What is the question?
options: What is the tallest mountain in North America?
What is the most dangerous mountain to climb?
What is the tallest mountain on Earth?
What mountain was first climbed in 1950?
questions.explanation: Mount Everest, at 29,032 feet (8,849 meters), is the tallest mountain on Earth, located in the Himalayas on the border of Nepal and Tibet.

questions.question: The answer is 'The Mona Lisa.' What is the question?
options: What is the most expensive painting ever sold?
What painting hangs in the Uffizi Gallery?
What is Leonardo da Vinci's most famous painting?
What painting was stolen in 1920?
questions.explanation: The Mona Lisa, painted by Leonardo da Vinci around 1503-1519, is his most famous painting and hangs in the Louvre Museum in Paris.

questions.question: The answer is '88 keys.' What is the question?
options: How many keys on a typewriter?
How many keys on a standard piano?
How many keys on an organ?
How many keys on an accordion?
questions.explanation: A standard piano has 88 keys — 52 white keys and 36 black keys, covering just over 7 octaves.

questions.question: The answer is 'Alexander Graham Bell.' What is the question?
options: Who invented the telegraph?
Who invented the radio?
Who invented the telephone?
Who invented the light bulb?
questions.explanation: Alexander Graham Bell is credited with inventing the first practical telephone in 1876.

questions.question: The answer is 'Seven.' What is the question?
options: How many continents are there?
How many oceans are there?
How many wonders of the ancient world?
Both A and C are correct
questions.explanation: There are seven continents and seven wonders of the ancient world, so both questions have 'seven' as their answer.

questions.question: The answer is 'The speed of light — approximately 186,000 miles per second.' What is the question?
options: What is the fastest speed achieved by a rocket?
What is the fastest thing in the universe?
What speed does electricity travel at?
What is the speed of sound in a vacuum?
questions.explanation: Light is the fastest thing in the universe, traveling at approximately 186,000 miles per second (about 300,000 km/s) in a vacuum.

questions.question: The answer is 'The Sahara.' What is the question?
options: What is the driest place on Earth?
What is the largest hot desert in the world?
What desert is in South America?
What is the oldest desert?
questions.explanation: The Sahara Desert in Africa is the largest hot desert in the world, covering about 3.6 million square miles.

questions.question: The answer is '1912.' What is the question?
options: When did World War I begin?
When was the Eiffel Tower built?
When did the Titanic sink?
When did Arizona become a state?
questions.explanation: The RMS Titanic sank on April 15, 1912, after hitting an iceberg during her maiden voyage from Southampton to New York City.

questions.question: The answer is 'Helium.' What is the question?
options: What is the lightest element?
What is the second element on the periodic table?
What gas makes balloons float?
All of the above are correct
questions.explanation: Helium is the second element on the periodic table, the second lightest element (after hydrogen), and the gas commonly used to make balloons float.

questions.question: The answer is 'The Great Wall of China.' What is the question?
options: What is the tallest structure ever built?
What is the longest wall ever built?
What was built in a single dynasty?
What is the oldest structure in Asia?
questions.explanation: The Great Wall of China is the longest wall ever built, stretching over 13,000 miles. It was constructed over many centuries by various Chinese dynasties.
